page.title: 12The Bridewell
page.content: I was standing inside the padded cell,and suddenly,Ifelt a shiver go down my spine.Two hundred years ago,insane people had stood in the same place,with strait jackets on.Now,a little sunlight creeps through the broken shutters.Long ago,the cell would have been in pitch darkness.In another cell,there is part of an old mattress made of rushes.The door has big studs,and near the top,an old grill.This was used to pass the prisoners their food.Down the passage,there is a chapel.Every single person had to pray,on Sunday mornings.Upstairs,there is an infirmary.You only went there if you were very,very ill.When I stood there,I felt as though there were prisoners still there,watching me. by Rebecca Allen Aged 11.
